intro: Allium peirsonii, commonly known as the Sierra onion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous base and grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Allium peirsonii is considered a rare and endangered species.
